p: Considering virus-induced lung inflammation, the excessive inflammation leads to tissue damage. In this regard, T cells seems to be reduced in COVID-19 patients, and the present T cells seemed to be functionally exhausted ( 111). Severe COVID-19 can induce ARDS in more than 50% of patients, and neutrophils are considered to be the central cells involved in the pathogenesis of ARDS. Infected female mice that were administered estradiol showed pulmonary recruitment of neutrophils and virus-specific CD8 T cells, releasing more INF-γ and TNF-α ( 112). Moreover, exogenous estrogen treatment in female mice infected with H1N1 reduced total pulmonary inflammation and the levels of pro-inflammatory genes in the lung ( 113).
